lines.text: You can't leave me here sitting in the snow! I'm mad about you... in my own foul way.
How's the insomnia?
Oh, I found some new sleeping pills. Red ones this time.
[Madeline has just introduced her fiancee to Garet and Courtland]
I don't believe a minute of it. Do you?
Garet, you're a very cynical man. You don't believe in true love.
You don't think Madeline does, too, do you?
I don't know, but I've always been facinated by miracles.
Madeleine you're a bundle of lies, a lovely bundle of lies, beautifully bound together.
Why do you have to go back to that bore Freddie, you haven't even given me a chance to make love to you.
You're doing alright.
You know its awfully hard making love to a woman who makes more money than me.
I always drink, particularly when I'm with you.
Am I that hard to take sober?
You're a voluptuous pain in the neck.
I wasn't very polite, was I.
As a matter of fact you don't look like an art editor, more like a work of art.
Mr Coulthard, I think you're a very dangerous man.
I was doing it my own way, playing by my own rules and nobody was hurt.
Nobody but yourself.
You've been insulting yourself Miss Damian, insulting your body and insulting your soul.
Then you'd drug yourself with the excitement of more excitement.
You're not helping me, you're insulting me.
You've been insulting yourself Miss Damian.
Beautiful would you mind popping out for a minute?
That's just 60 seconds, you better talk fast.
You really are a rat aren't you.
As a blackmailer, you are pitiful.
I only earn $100 a week and you know I can't live on that.
I'm in love - now laugh if you want.
Men prefer to keep their illusions, don't they.
You're looking for security from someone else instead of building it in yourself.
Falling in love doesn't cure everything overnight.
Beautiful would you mind popping out for a minute?
That's just 60 seconds, you better talk fast.
I only earn $100 a week and you know I can't live on that.
Mr Garet believes that the world owes him a gay life. No matter who pays for it.
Let's face it, she's a changed woman.
She'll never change, she just got herself a new set of words, that's all.
Why do you always hound me? You know I despite you and everything you stand for.
There's always a chance I may be able to improve your opinion, and your manners.
I thought you were something wonderful and you turned out to be something else.
She's been living in an area of infection and she's removed herself from it.
I take it you consider me part of the contamination.
You've come here for information, not diagnosis. I sually charge people for insulting them.
Miss Damien told me to tell you if you inquire that she's busy growing herself a new soul. Now will you please keep off the grass.
Say, women are supposed to scream, are you afraid of mice?
No but next time I'll scream.
Say, you're an artist aren't you?
I don't know.
You speak Russian?
Over a bottle of vodka everybody speaks Russian.
You're a very lovely girl.
You're not being very scientific Doctor.
That's the very heart of science, the truth.
Lets talk about insulin.
Her twisted soul was bent on heartless deceit.
The whole truth about the human soul is a complicated proposition.
My father was very much in love with life.
That's a Hungarian custom isn't it.
And desperate eyes, full of shadows.
Insomnia does that.
Perhaps you find the idea of living not very attractive.
And you don't want anyone to see inside, perhaps you don't even want to take a look yourself. My, women haven't the courage to face themselves so they look for escape on one excitement after another.
I didn't hire you to gossip about my personal life.
You don't care because it's too much fun.
He was the happiest of men in the world until he killed himself.
You know you need relaxing, lots of relaxing, I can hear your nerves snapping like rubber bands.
Your life hasn't been gay and glamorous at all. It's just been muddled and senseless.
